andhrapradesh.title: Andhra Pradesh - GeoLearn
andhrapradesh.info: Andhra Pradesh, known for its beautiful beaches and rich cultural heritage, is located on the southeastern coast of India.
cards: Andhra Pradesh is home to the famous temple town of Tirupati, one of the richest pilgrimage sites in the world.
The state is known for its delicious cuisine, especially its spicy Andhra food.
Kolleru Lake in Andhra Pradesh is one of the largest freshwater lakes in India.

arunachalpradesh.title: Arunachal Pradesh - GeoLearn
arunachalpradesh.info: Arunachal Pradesh, located in the northeastern part of India, is known for its lush green landscapes and vibrant tribal culture.
cards: Arunachal Pradesh is often called the 'Land of the Rising Sun' as it is the first place in India to witness sunrise.
The Tawang Monastery in Arunachal Pradesh is the second-largest Buddhist monastery in the world.
Arunachal Pradesh is home to several indigenous tribes with unique traditions and cultures.

assam.title: Assam - GeoLearn
assam.info: Assam, located in the northeastern region, is famous for its tea gardens, wildlife, and rich history.
cards: Assam is the birthplace of the world-famous Assam tea, known for its strong flavor.
Kaziranga National Park in Assam is home to the largest population of one-horned rhinoceroses.
The Brahmaputra River, one of the longest rivers in the world, flows through Assam.

bihar.title: Bihar - GeoLearn
bihar.info: Bihar, one of the oldest states in India, is known for its historical significance and educational heritage.
cards: Bihar is the birthplace of Lord Buddha and the site of the ancient Nalanda University.
The state is known for its vibrant festivals, including Chhath Puja.
Patna, the capital of Bihar, was once the capital of the ancient Magadh empire.

chhattisgarh.title: Chhattisgarh - GeoLearn
chhattisgarh.info: Chhattisgarh, known for its mineral resources and dense forests, is a major industrial hub in India.
cards: Chhattisgarh is home to the famous Chitrakote Falls, often referred to as the 'Niagara of India'.
The state is rich in tribal culture and has a large number of tribal communities.
Chhattisgarh's Bastar region is known for its unique art and craft traditions.

goa.title: Goa - GeoLearn
goa.info: Goa, a small coastal state, is famous for its stunning beaches, Portuguese-influenced architecture, and vibrant nightlife.
cards: Goa is known for its beautiful beaches like Baga, Calangute, and Anjuna.
The state has a unique blend of Indian and Portuguese cultures, visible in its churches and cuisine.
Goa hosts one of the most famous carnival festivals in India.

gujarat.title: Gujarat - GeoLearn
gujarat.info: Gujarat, located on the western coast of India, is known for its diverse culture, rich history, and major economic contributions.
cards: Gujarat is the birthplace of Mahatma Gandhi, the father of the nation.
The state is home to the Rann of Kutch, known for its white salt desert and the Rann Utsav.
Gujarat has the longest coastline of any Indian state, stretching over 1,600 km.

haryana.title: Haryana - GeoLearn
haryana.info: Haryana, a northern state, is known for its agriculture, sports achievements, and proximity to Delhi.
cards: Haryana has produced many prominent wrestlers and athletes in India.
The state is known for its vast fields of wheat and rice.
Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary in Haryana is home to many migratory birds.

himachalpradesh.title: Himachal Pradesh - GeoLearn
himachalpradesh.info: Himachal Pradesh, located in the Himalayan region, is known for its scenic landscapes and tourist destinations.
cards: Shimla, the capital of Himachal Pradesh, was once the summer capital of British India.
The Great Himalayan National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage site.
Himachal Pradesh is known for its apple orchards, particularly in Kullu and Manali.

jharkhand.title: Jharkhand - GeoLearn
jharkhand.info: Jharkhand, located in eastern India, is rich in minerals, forests, and wildlife.
cards: Jharkhand is home to the famous Parasnath Hill, a pilgrimage site for Jainism.
The state has a large tribal population, with unique cultures and traditions.
The Betla National Park is a major wildlife sanctuary in Jharkhand.

karnataka.title: Karnataka - GeoLearn
karnataka.info: Karnataka, located in the southwestern part of India, is known for its historical sites, rich culture, and thriving IT industry.
cards: Bangalore, the capital city, is known as the 'Silicon Valley of India'.
Hampi, a UNESCO World Heritage site, was once the capital of the Vijayanagara Empire.
Karnataka is known for its coffee plantations in Coorg.

kerala.title: Kerala - GeoLearn
kerala.info: Kerala, known for its backwaters, palm-lined beaches, and rich cultural heritage, is a popular tourist destination.
cards: Kerala is often called 'God's Own Country' due to its natural beauty.
The backwaters of Kerala, including Alleppey and Kumarakom, are famous for houseboat rides.
Kerala is the birthplace of Ayurveda, the ancient Indian system of medicine.

madhyapradesh.title: Madhya Pradesh - GeoLearn
madhyapradesh.info: Madhya Pradesh, the heart of India, is known for its rich history, wildlife, and historical monuments.
cards: Khajuraho, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is famous for its ancient temples with intricate erotic sculptures.
The Kanha National Park in Madhya Pradesh is one of the largest national parks in India.
The state is home to the ancient city of Ujjain, an important Hindu pilgrimage site.

maharashtra.title: Maharashtra - GeoLearn
maharashtra.info: Maharashtra, located in western India, is known for its diverse landscapes, rich culture, and financial hub, Mumbai.
cards: Mumbai, the capital of Maharashtra, is the entertainment capital of India and home to Bollywood.
Maharashtra is home to Ajanta and Ellora caves, famous for their ancient rock-cut temples and monasteries.
The state is known for its delicious vada pav, pav bhaji, and puran poli.

manipur.title: Manipur - GeoLearn
manipur.info: Manipur, located in the northeastern part of India, is known for its vibrant culture, dance, and natural beauty.
cards: Manipur is known for its classical dance form, Manipuri, which is a UNESCO intangible cultural heritage.
The Loktak Lake, with its floating phumdis, is the largest freshwater lake in northeastern India.
Manipur is famous for its handloom products, especially its shawls and textiles.

meghalaya.title: Meghalaya - GeoLearn
meghalaya.info: Meghalaya, located in the northeastern region, is known for its scenic beauty, living root bridges, and rich culture.
cards: Meghalaya is known as the 'Abode of Clouds' due to its high rainfall and misty weather.
The living root bridges in Meghalaya are unique, made by weaving the roots of trees.
Cherrapunji in Meghalaya was once considered the wettest place on Earth.

mizoram.title: Mizoram - GeoLearn
mizoram.info: Mizoram, located in the northeastern region, is known for its scenic landscapes, tribal culture, and rich biodiversity.
cards: Mizoram is home to the Mizo people, known for their music, dance, and festivals.
The state is famous for its lush green hills, valleys, and bamboo forests.
Mizoram has one of the highest literacy rates in India.

nagaland.title: Nagaland - GeoLearn
nagaland.info: Nagaland, situated in the northeastern corner of India, is known for its colorful festivals, tribal culture, and hilly terrain.
cards: Nagaland is known for the Hornbill Festival, which showcases the state's tribal culture and traditions.
The state has several indigenous tribes, each with its own unique customs and languages.
Nagaland is rich in flora and fauna, with many species found nowhere else in India.

odisha.title: Odisha - GeoLearn
odisha.info: Odisha, located on the eastern coast of India, is known for its ancient temples, rich history, and vibrant culture.
cards: Odisha is home to the famous Jagannath Temple in Puri, which attracts millions of devotees during the Rath Yatra.
The state has a rich tradition of dance and music, with Odissi being one of the classical dance forms of India.
Konark Sun Temple, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is one of the most iconic temples in India.

punjab.title: Punjab - GeoLearn
punjab.info: Punjab, located in the northwestern region, is known for its agricultural prosperity, vibrant culture, and historic significance.
cards: Punjab is the land of the 'Golden Temple' in Amritsar, a major pilgrimage site for Sikhs.
The state is famous for its rich food culture, including dishes like butter chicken and sarson da saag.
Punjab is the breadbasket of India, producing a significant amount of the country's food crops.

rajasthan.title: Rajasthan - GeoLearn
rajasthan.info: Rajasthan, located in the northwestern part of India, is known for its desert landscapes, royal palaces, and colorful festivals.
cards: Rajasthan is home to the Thar Desert, the largest desert in India.
The state is famous for its majestic palaces and forts, including the Amer Fort and the City Palace in Udaipur.
Jaipur, the capital city, is known as the 'Pink City' for its distinctive pink-colored buildings.

sikkim.title: Sikkim - GeoLearn
sikkim.info: Sikkim, located in the northeastern part of India, is known for its picturesque landscapes, Buddhist monasteries, and rich biodiversity.
cards: Sikkim is home to the third-highest mountain in the world, Kangchenjunga.
The state has a unique blend of Hindu and Buddhist cultures, with several monasteries and temples.
Sikkim is known for its organic farming and is the first fully organic state in India.

tamilNadu.title: Tamil Nadu - GeoLearn
tamilNadu.info: Tamil Nadu, located in the southern part of India, is known for its Dravidian architecture, classical music, and vibrant culture.
cards: Chennai, the capital of Tamil Nadu, is known as the 'Detroit of India' due to its automotive industry.
The state is famous for its ancient temples, such as the Meenakshi Temple in Madurai.
Tamil Nadu is a major center for Bharatanatyam, a classical Indian dance form.

telangana.title: Telangana - GeoLearn
telangana.info: Telangana, located in southern India, is known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and growing IT industry.
cards: Hyderabad, the capital of Telangana, is known for its historical sites and the iconic Charminar.
The state is famous for its Hyderabadi biryani, a dish of royal origin.
Telangana is home to several ancient temples and forts, including the Warangal Fort.

tripura.title: Tripura - GeoLearn
tripura.info: Tripura, located in the northeastern region, is known for its royal heritage, cultural diversity, and beautiful landscapes.
cards: Tripura is home to the Tripura Sundari Temple, one of the 51 Shakti Peethas in India.
The state has a rich tradition of handlooms and handicrafts, particularly its woven carpets.
The state is known for its wildlife sanctuaries, such as the Sepahijala Wildlife Sanctuary.

uttarakhand.title: Uttarakhand - GeoLearn
uttarakhand.info: Uttarakhand, located in the northern part of India, is known for its scenic mountains, pilgrimage sites, and natural beauty.
cards: Uttarakhand is known for its two famous pilgrimage sites: Haridwar and Rishikesh.
The state is home to several hill stations, such as Nainital and Mussoorie.
Nanda Devi, located in Uttarakhand, is the second-highest mountain in India.

uttarpradesh.title: Uttar Pradesh - GeoLearn
uttarpradesh.info: Uttar Pradesh, located in the northern part of India, is one of the most populous states, known for its historical significance and religious landmarks.
cards: Uttar Pradesh is home to the Taj Mahal, one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
The city of Varanasi, on the banks of the Ganges, is one of the oldest living cities in the world.
The Kumbh Mela, held in Allahabad, is one of the largest religious gatherings in the world.

westbengal.title: West Bengal - GeoLearn
westbengal.info: West Bengal, located in the eastern part of India, is known for its rich cultural heritage, intellectual legacy, and historical significance.
cards: Kolkata, the capital of West Bengal, is known as the 'City of Joy' for its vibrant culture and festivals.
West Bengal is the birthplace of many great poets and intellectuals, including Rabindranath Tagore.
The Sundarbans, the largest mangrove forest in the world, is located in West Bengal.
